attributes.action: House of Commons to have Free Vote on Imposition of Junior Doctors Contract
attributes.additional_details: Considering the importance to the functioning of a National Public Service that is in everyone's interests and the vast media coverage and interest it must be put to a Free Vote.
attributes.background: The government have chosen to impose a contract on Junior Doctors without evidence that such a contract would improve weekend care without deterioration of weekday care.  Imposition is rejected by the Royal Colleges and Hospital Chief Execs.  It must be put to the House in a Free Vote without Whips.

government_response.summary: An agreement has been reached that will make the junior doctors’ contract better for doctors and patients. It is supported by the British Medical Association, which will ballot junior doctors in June.
